description: Alterations to include the excavation to create basement parking area and associated hard and soft landscaping works.
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed garden storage and pergola would, by reason of its height, scale and location would represent a prominent and incongruous addition that would result in harm to the character and appearance of the dwellinghouse, streetscene and Battersea Park Conservation Area. The level of harm would not be outweighed by public benefits. The proposal therefore fails to comply with the NPPF (2023), policies LP1, LP3 and LP5 of the Local Plan (2023) and the guidance within the Housing SPD.

Reason : 2 - The application has failed to provide sufficient arboricultural reason and justification for the removal of the three mature Lime trees (TG3) along the southwestern boundary of the property and protected by the Tree Preservation Order (T19, T20 and T21 of ref no.10/1996). Additionally, the mature trees make a positive contribution to local visual amenity and their loss on the site would result in harm to the character and appearance of the Battersea Park Conservation Area. The level of harm would not be outweighed by public benefits. Accordingly the proposal would therefore fail to comply with the NPPF (2023), policies LP3 and LP56 of the Local Plan (2023).

Reason : 3 - The proposed development would not provide a minimum of 1metre of naturally draining permeable soil together with the minimum 200mm drainage layer above the basement in the garden area. The development would therefore reduce opportunities for planting and not provide adequate sustainable drainage for the development. The proposal therefore fails to comply with policy LP6 of the Local Plan (2023).
